reviews.sentence: Trendy Luxurious. I stayed at Mondrian last year and had a wonderful experience. The hotel staff were friendly and professional. The vibe is fantastic during summer the bar is the place to be the evening and has a great crowd. Although the pool is crowded and full of locals trying to act cool the staff always found us a spot they do prioritise their hotel guests which is fantastic. The concierge was friendly and always gave me great advice. Furthermore the view we had from the room was breathtaking we also had a little stylish balcony which was fantastic for the evening during sunset. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in LA in fact I recommend any hotel by Morgans Hotel Group. Mondrian was the second hotel of their hotels we stayed and and we then went on to Delano and now other 2 of their hotels in NYC as they always deliver and go beyond our expectations.

LA visit. This hotel is conveniently located and is extremely beautiful. The rooms are large and have nice views of LA. The pool area is absolutely breath taking. The restaurant on site is wonderful too and has really fun cocktails.

Great last night in LA. My husband and I booked The Mondrian for our last night of our honeymoon having flown in from a cycling tour around Central America. The hotel has the fun young and vibrant atmosphere we were expecting and we were not disappointed overall. We did have issues with the water supply in our room culminating in us having a plumber visit in the wee hours of the morning but the staff were quick to rectify the issues. Also as there was a pool party on the Sunday the toilets in the lobby were left in quite a disguating state I refrained from using them completely. We would definitely stay at the hotel again however.

Almost perfect. I spent a week at The Mondrian at the beginning of May I had been looking forward to the trip for some time and it did not disappoint. This was my first trip to LA and I arrived at about 8 pm. I was greeted by a very friendly lady on reception called Jenny who made check in smooth and stress free. The only thing I would say is that I had to take my case up to my room myself. I could have probably waited for someone to bring it up but no one offered and by that time I was exhausted and just wanted to get up to my room and crash out. I had booked a standard room with no extras and it was very spacious with a great view. In fact I could see right across the city and it is probably one of the best views I have ever had in a hotel. The bathroom had lots of nice little toiletries and a space where you could sit and do your makeup etc. There was no bath but the shower was enormous and was more than adequate. The bed itself was one of the comfiest I have ever slept in. Plenty of hanging space for clothing and even though the number of hangers was limited a quick phone call to housekeeping and I soon had all the hangers I could nedI spent the afternoon of my first day at the hotel relaxing by the pool. The drinks were quite expensive but no more than what you could expect to pay at such a place in LA. The pool area was nice and clean as were the loungers. The only thing I would say is that whilst I was able to get a sunbed at the beginning of the week and to relax and read by the end if the week ie Friday Saturday not a chance. The hotel turns into a party hotel with loud music and not much chance of getting a sunbed and having a quiet read. Despite this being a party hotel at the weekends I have to say the noise level was zero. I was able to get a good nights sleep every night. Towards the middle of the week I had a personal issue nothing to do with the hotel. Jenny on reception went out of her way to help me out and I was very grateful for this. Another member of staff who really stands out at The Mondrian for going out of his way to deliver an excellent standard of service is Greg the concierge. Greg was fantastic at getting me tickets for the parks that I wanted to go to and also for helping me find my way around LA. He was always very cheerful and is a real asset to The Mondrian. I enjoyed room service at The Mondrian on a couple of occasions. The food was delivered quickly and was hot when it came. It was also deliciousCheck out again could not have be more straightforward. would not hesitate to stay at The Mondrian again.

Party central. If it is all night pool parties your after then look no further this hotel has a really bad smell throughout beds are really uncomfortable and staff hanging around the entrance to the hotel smoking unprofessional to say the least if you are travelling as a family do not stay here.
Pool area was covered for the weekend we should have been notified before we booked.

Mondrian stay. A trendy hotel valet parking available but if a few cars turn up at once you will have to wait some time in single file. Corridors to rooms are gloomy. But once in a room it is bright and airy. If you are on the left side of the hotel the view over LA is beautiful. The room has a large and pretty cool mirror that becomes a tv in the room but it is very imposing. I did not manage evening access to the pool area due to private parties. The bar closed pretty early but was staffed by an excellent head barman. There is a lack of places to sit to enjoy a drink as seating is part of the restaurant. Hotel location is good for accessing anywhere in the area via Uber etc. and is opposite the Comedy Store and Katana Resturant which make for good nights out.

Must stay at Mondrian. Excellent location. Staff were quite helpful. They even Upgraded me to a pool view room. Thumbs up to Mondrian. The Skybar staff were very friendly and gave us tips for our road trip to SF. The view from the Skybar was mind blowingThe renovation kind of dampens the look but all in all it was a beautiful place to stay.

Disappointment. Chose hotel for the pool and photos of the room. When we arrived for our one night stay we were informed that the pool was closed for a private event until 7 pm. There was a concession offered of to spend 60 at the bar at 7 pm but we had dinner plans. There was also an offer to get us into another hotels pool but that was not a suitable substitute to us. The room smelled of cigarette smoke from the surrounding patios and later marijuana. The lack of cleanliness of the shower was unacceptable with mildew and green algae inside. We were awoken in the night by intoxicated residents trying to enter the room next door. The hotel was obviously a party destination with the rooms and overnight guests an afterthought. We would not stay here again.

Spectacular Hotel. Very nice room and a great view on the 9th. floor of the pool area. We were only there one night and would have liked to stay another night or so. Close to all things we were looking for including the Dodger Game.

Disgusting hotel top to bottom. I stayed on business in CA for 3 days here having booked online. The hotel is disgustingly dirty dated with rubbish in the rooms on balconies and extremly grubby furniture curtains floor etc. I was totally disgusted to stay here as photos in no way matched the ones online. Modrian must be ashamed of themselves charging so much for a basic dirty room and absolutely appalling breakfast service. Breakfast took over an hour to arrive it isasn order service and there is no buffet or any kind of self service bill did not arrive for another half an hour. Honestly in the US a hotel with these standards should go under administration. Dreadful. On my second day I was late waiting for a bill again and left without paying as no one paid any attention to me waiting with a credit card in hand for over 45 minutes. They chased me down the hallway and I then paid. Never againThe room charges for toiletries sitting on your table which you open not suspecting they are chargeable extras. Shower gel was 25 bucks. What a waste of money and how considerate. The food can not be called average breakfast was simply inedible greasy and very overpriced. I had to take an uber to go out for dinner in Chateau Marmont. 5 mins drive around the corner. One more thing. Noise was extremely loud as the wild nights with super loud dance music took place daily until 3 4am. I was on the upper floor and had a pillow on my head still hearing it very well. The visitors from other hotels came in to share the pool. I am disgusted to have wasted three days of my life on this place. Would never in my life visit it again. Stay away.

Lovely hotel suites are gorgeous. I very much enjoyed my recent stay at the Mondrian. Whilst staff were not especially helpful they were friendly enough. Our one bedroom suite was just gorgeous very light and comfortable and with an incredible view of downtown LA. The pool bar is just great and I love the West Hollywood location although it may be a little grungy for some. All in all a great stay.
Very nice great pool.

Excellent location clean and friendly. We had a wonderful view and our room was super cool. Great pool parties. The location was nice and the place was very hip. Too many things to add. Everything lets just say. Prices of drinks at pool were expensive.

Mondrian has great views and a great location. The pool is a scene but your room is serene. Great location and comfortable accommodations. Spacious room and good for entertaining or working in peace. The bathroom is an odd layout but the Malin and Goetz soaps and cleansers are appreciated. The pool is a scene on the weekends get there early to get a spot even for hotel guests and even on a Monday afternoon it is still energetic and fun. I enjoyed the restaurant for a quiet morning breakfast overlooking the city and I took the opportunity to see a show at The Comedy Store right across the street. Sunset Tower Bar is a great neighboring hotel for cocktails. Room service was pricey as expected but with a CVS down the street grab some Fiji water and snacks as backup sustenance. Definitely ask the attendant for the wifi code instead of inputing your room.

Lack of communication. We went to enjoy the LA sun and lie by the hotel pool. once we arrived to the pool we realized that it had been enclosed for the winter season which was never communicated to us by the hotel or Expedia prior to arrival. Extremely disappointing and unprofessional.
Beaut setting great vibes lovely staff exquisite cocktails yum food awesome views cool pool. What more could you ask for.

Good hotel for affordable price. Everything was good location food nice pool and good service. The only thing we did n’t like was the private party that limited access to pool and outside bar for the whole evening.

Sunset Chic. I have always loved The Mondrian it was my 4th stay in less than 10 years and everything has been and still is high end. The hotel has great location in WoHocorner of Sunset and La Cienega. Since the early days the deco has been uplifted 3 times i stayed in the 3 versions from the original Starck all white to the rent 70s revival inspired stunning new look. What i really enjoyed is that they kept the iconic spirit of the hotel the lobby keeps its original spirit with a few novelties i love the art on display and especially the Clint Eastwod Leone printThe rooms have very nice volume and the bathrooms have really been improved. We stayed in a junior suite and it was very nicewonderful pool area that has not changed. Friendly and professional staff. Will definitely keep coming back.

Mondrian hotel was perfect. We had a great time. The room was perfect. Dinner at the Ivory on Sunset was great. The Ambience of contemporary modern decor various varieties of exotic plants and art was the icing on the cake. Beautiful polside and bar lounge areas.

it is got that modern vibe with views of the city from the pool and restaurant areas. The hotel has finished it renovations which means that the paint smell is still there but undergoing the modern transformation makes it a hip place to stay and by the number of people smiling at the pool and around the lobby I am not the only person thinking this is a good place to stay. The WiFi is decent and not slow the restaurant is above par and I like it is breakfast with arugula sald with my eggs. This is the hotel for us when we need to be near LA but not being directly in downtown LA.

Location is what I like most about the Mondrian and the size of the rooms. The pool and SKY bar area is fantastic as is the size of the rooms. Heaps of space nice and quiet. The front desk check in was slow disorganised and not very helpful.
